Next, create loop_2 using the following details: - Circle_1: Center coordinates at (0.008, 0.008) and Radius of 0.0041. After defining the loops, create a 2D sketch for this part with the above-defined face. For the extrusion step, scale the sketch by 0.0161 and then extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.5893 and in the opposite normal direction by 0.0 inches. Perform a 'New Body Feature Operation'. Part 2: A cylindrical object with a tapered end, standing upright. Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the Translation Vector to (0.0, 0.1607, 0.0). For this part, we will again draw two circular loops on a single face to create the tapered cylindrical shape. Create a new face (face_1) and then create loop_1 using the following details: - Circle_1: Center coordinates at (0.008, 0.008) and Radius of 0.008. Next, create loop_2 using the following details: - Circle_1: Center coordinates at (0.008, 0.008) and Radius of 0.0075. After defining the loops, create a 2D sketch for this part with the above-defined face. For the extrusion step, scale the sketch by 0.0161 and then extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.1607 and in the opposite normal direction by 0.0 inches. Perform a 'Join Feature Operation'. This part completes the construction of the rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width, and the length is three times the width. The object is centered in the image.</description>
